snippet: Jia Hou and Xing Wu Pan were convicted for their roles in trying to steer money to the campaign of John C. Liu, a Democratic candidate for mayor, through illegal fund-raising.
abstract: Jia Hou and Xing Wu Pan are convicted for their roles in attempting to funnel money to the campaign of New York City Comptroller John C Liu, Democratic candidate for mayor, through illegal fundraising; lawyers for both men say their clients will appeal.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Russ Buettner, David W. Chen, Alain Delaquérière, Javier C. Hernández and Jack Styczysnki.

lead_paragraph: Jia Hou and Xing Wu Pan were convicted for their roles in trying to steer money to the campaign of John C. Liu, a Democratic candidate for mayor, through illegal fund-raising.

headline.seo: Former Liu Associates Convicted in Fund-Raising Case
headline.main: Two Former Liu Associates Are Found Guilty in Campaign-Finance Scheme
headline.print_headline: Two Former Liu Associates Are Found Guilty in Campaign Finance Scheme
